reference: Barro, Robert J. 1989. Interest-Rate Targeting. Journal of Monetary Economics, 23 (January), 3-30.
Blinder, Alan S. 1979. Economic Policy and the Great Stagflation. New York: Academic Press.
Friedman, Benjamin M. 1997. The Rise and Fall of Money Growth Targets as Guidelines for U.S. Monetary Policy. Kuroda (ed.), Towards More Effective Monetary Policy. Houndmills: Macmillan Press.
Friedman, Benjamin M. 2004. Why the Federal Reserve Should Not Adopt Inflation Targeting. International Finance, 7 (March), 129-136.
Mishkin, Frederic S. 2004. Why the Fed Should Adopt Inflation Targeting. International Finance, 7 (March), 117-127.
Orphanides, Athanasios. 2004. Monetary Policy Rules, Macroeconomic Stability, and Inflation: A View from the Trenches. Journal of Money, Credit, and Banking, 36 (April), 151-175.
Sargent, Thomas J., and Timothy Cogley. 2005. The Conquest of U.S. Inflation: Learning, Model Uncertainty, and Robustness. Review of Economic Dynamics, forthcoming.
